/home/haiyan/Research/CentralizedAgentFr.content_with_line_numbers:
1â†’module adder_16bit #(
   2â†’    parameter WIDTH = 16
   3â†’) (
   4â†’    input clk,
   5â†’    input rst,
   6â†’    input [WIDTH-1:0] a,
   7â†’    input [WIDTH-1:0] b,
   8â†’    input cin,
   9â†’    output reg [WIDTH-1:0] sum,
  10â†’    output reg cout,
  11â†’    output reg overflow
  12â†’);
  13â†’
  14â†’// Internal signals for intermediate calculations
  15â†’reg [WIDTH:0] internal_sum;
  16â†’reg [WIDTH:0] temp_sum;
  17â†’
  18â†’// Sequential logic block for synchronous update
  19â†’always @(posedge clk or posedge rst) begin
  20â†’    if (rst) begin
  21â†’        sum <= 16'd0;
  22â†’        cout <= 1'b0;
  23â†’        overflow <= 1'b0;
  24â†’    end else begin
  25â†’        // Perform 16-bit addition with carry-in
  26â†’        temp_sum = {1'b0, a} + {1'b0, b} + cin;
  27â†’        internal_sum = temp_sum;
  28â†’
  29â†’        // Assign outputs
  30â†’        sum <= internal_sum[WIDTH-1:0];
  31â†’        cout <= internal_sum[WIDTH];
  32â†’
  33â†’        // Detect signed overflow: when both operands have same sign but result has opposite sign
  34â†’        // Overflow occurs if (a_sign == b_sign) && (a_sign != result_sign)
  35â†’        overflow <= (a[WIDTH-1] == b[WIDTH-1]) && (a[WIDTH-1] != internal_sum[WIDTH-1]);
  36â†’    end
  37â†’end
  38â†’
  39â†’endmodule

/home/haiyan/Research/CentralizedAgentFr.content_with_line_numbers:
1â†’module adder_16bit #(
   2â†’    parameter WIDTH = 16
   3â†’) (
   4â†’    input clk,
   5â†’    input rst,
   6â†’    input [WIDTH-1:0] a,
   7â†’    input [WIDTH-1:0] b,
   8â†’    input cin,
   9â†’    output reg [WIDTH-1:0] sum,
  10â†’    output reg cout,
  11â†’    output reg overflow
  12â†’);
  13â†’
  14â†’// Internal signals for carry propagation
  15â†’reg [WIDTH-1:0] carry;
  16â†’
  17â†’// Combinational logic for ripple-carry adder
  18â†’always @(*) begin
  19â†’    // Initialize carry chain
  20â†’    carry[0] = cin;
  21â†’    
  22â†’    // Ripple-carry addition
  23â†’    for (int i = 0; i < WIDTH; i++) begin
  24â†’        {carry[i+1], sum[i]} = a[i] + b[i] + carry[i];
  25â†’    end
  26â†’    
  27â†’    // Output carry
  28â†’    cout = carry[WIDTH];
  29â†’    
  30â†’    // Overflow detection for signed arithmetic:
  31â†’    // Overflow occurs when two positive numbers produce a negative result,
  32â†’    // or two negative numbers produce a positive result.
  33â†’    // This is detected by comparing the sign bits of inputs and output.
  34â†’    overflow = (a[WIDTH-1] == b[WIDTH-1]) && (a[WIDTH-1] != sum[WIDTH-1]);
  35â†’end
  36â†’
  37â†’// Synchronous reset for output registers
  38â†’always @(posedge clk or posedge rst) begin
  39â†’    if (rst) begin
  40â†’        sum <= 16'd0;
  41â†’        cout <= 1'b0;
  42â†’        overflow <= 1'b0;
  43â†’    end else begin
  44â†’        // Outputs are updated on every clock cycle based on combinational logic
  45â†’        // No need to reassign in this block since they're driven by combinational logic
  46â†’        // The register behavior is implicit through the always block
  47â†’    end
  48â†’end
  49â†’
  50â†’endmodule
